column1: How can I obtain Tripadvisor's tax residence certificate for 2019 and 2020? Need this for my taxes. Thanks
I have no idea.
You should ask on the Owners Forum, but I don't know how Tripadvisor could issue a tax residence certificate. Surely that would have to be issued by the country that you're a tax resident in?
This seems to have been posted in the ‘World’ forum, so at least the Op has covered all bases of where it should be posted.
Reperted as not forum related (spam)
Does this show on every Forum? I couldn't see what it has to do with Travelling with disabilities !
Yep, showing on all forums for me.

Sasha ~Do you own a B&B or hotel or inn? Or do you own a Vacation Rental through TA's VR partners Holiday Lettings or Flipkey? The directions for what to do will be different.And how in the world did you find the World Forum to post to? :-)))
Did not know a world forum existed. Awesome. Hi all!

It appears to be a hack of some sort, it shows up in the profile as posted in the “Root” forum and is showing up on every forum so far as I’m aware. Presumably a dig at TA’s tax residence, not that I know where that is.
Just report it as inappropriate / wrong forum
Simon will be able to tell you .
All very odd when I click Browse all World topics »I get https:/…ListForums-g1-i1-World.htmlclicked it world on the list of topics on the UK forum and got https:/…ListForums-g1-i1-World.html

Tax residence certificate is a mechanism to prevent paying double taxes in two countries. The document is issued by tax authorities of the country of residence upon taxpayer's request. I don't know what the exact question of OP is. If it is about the certificate, it is not related to TA. But it might be he has a certificate and wants to have the double tax back that might have been charged for an international transfer.
I hope you get an answer, I will search for an answer from my close people

The OP is very likely an owner of a property as post 7 has said. From what I have read in the Support Forum, a Vacation Rental owner gets income from their TA listings. TA do issue some kind of tax info record. I do not know about hotels or inns.But I'm afraid this thread will get closed due to some itchy fingers, so the OP will not be able to get the advice she needs unless she posts again.
Why is this showing up in Mazatlan forum ?
Sasha, if this thread is deleted, use the following link to the Support Forum to ask your question. And please say what kind of property you own.https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowForum-g1-i12…
This is showing up on ALL forums. Report & ignore it.

He has hacked the site look in his profile and in his list of postings you will see the forum is not called world forum its root forum his posting is showing on every forum Ive reported him others should to
Yes this thread is showing on every forum I frequent. Mystery how the OP found 'World' forum but when you look at OP's profile the forum listed is 'Root' forum !!Angie.
World Forum!! Yeh boi
Hi all from Mexico.
Ive reported his profile others should https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/GeneralSupport…
I'm fairly impressed by this to be honest.
“ Ive reported his profile others should”—-For what reason? I’d say it’s more than likely a bug on the TA website.
Whatever is occurring. Is the doorman on a tea break?
Interesting that it is still not removed although reported?
Ive reported it so if its not a hack but a problem with TA they can fix it

This is the first time I've encountered this. I can now see this on any forum but how do you reach the root forum? It's clearly better than the world forum where nobody would see a post.SWT
It takes a while Arthur. TA are hours behind us, literally lol.
As stated it is appearing on other forums. I just saw it on the Hua Hin Forum in Thailand as well as this Gambia forum.TA admins will need to deal with it.

Hi all from WALES & to all WELSH people around the world, an early Happy St David's Day for our National Day 1st March. Dydd Gwyl Dewi Sant Hapus i pawb-Happy St David's Day to all.flygt-hola to Mexico-be with you in a few weeks again. Cabo St Lucas for our 1st visit to Cabo but 8th Mexican jaunt.
surely it will go at some stage. so we should enjoy the global conversation while it is still possible !
This is indeed a strange one...hello World from Canada :) Be nice if Sasha responded to explain before this unique World forum becomes just a Country one :)Edited: 4:45 am, February 28, 2020
Not showing on the *Universe* forum yet??
Greetings from Australia so glad to see there are so many trip advisor helpers all over the world.
if it is on multiple fora, how come it only shows 1 post on his profile ?
I didn't know there was a world out there, I though it ended at Tralee .....
""""""Not showing on the *Universe* forum yet??"""""""Give it time Arthur!!!
Is that Arthur Dent out there? this IS getting exciting
Let's hope TA can soon take action and remove this thread.
where is colleen when we need her??
Let's hope TA can soon take action and remove this thread.————————Why?
Greetings to Dingle, one of my favourite short stay destinations.
Hola Bellagio nice to see you again.
Perhaps it is TA Colleen posting ...yes, cold and wet here today, waiting for the next blast off the Atlantic, love a good storm.Edited: 5:02 am, February 28, 2020
brittraveller31LWhy?Because somehow the OP has managed to get this thread to show on all TA forums.

"if it is on multiple fora, how come it only shows 1 post on his profile ?"--It's how the forums are designed to work. If someone posted in the Dublin forum, it would show up in the Province of Leinster forum, and the Ireland forum. Also if there were forums at Europe level & the World level they would also show up there - but as there aren't forums at those levels that's why you can't see posts. That's why I believe that this thread has highlighted a bug somewhere on the website.
Wow.....over 50 replies to the forum post in less than an hour!!!Is that a record????John
Must be a glitch with the infinity drive. Xaphod Beeblebrox will be along shortly. You know .... “brain the size of a planet” ......
And my reply on the Maldives forum is also shown on the Oludeniz, Turkey forum!!!John
***if it is on multiple forum, how come it only shows 1 post on his profile ?***Sasha will only show another post when he responds to this thread or makes another post somewhere.
I believe you are looking for the Venusian forum, this forum is for Earth.Klaatu barada nikto
Houston, we have a problem l.o.l. !!!!!!!!
Just wanted to say hi World again from Toronto and he Cuba forum :) This is like a new kind of virus free Global warming :)
It's the Sashonavirus!
Western Australia represented!!!Hi back to all the Welsh responders, memories of my dad singing "whales, whales ... great fishes are whales"

Houston here. We have had a huge water main break- 96 inch pipe broke/ construction crews damaged it. Couple million people affected. I am up boiling water to drink so y’all will need to fix this on your own! Best wishes!

Good morning World...this is kinda fun other than the missing stars and bursting pipes :)

Sasha was posting reviews in Cyrillic until 2015, then one anodyne one in English in 2019. This is the first forum post. Smells like a hack to me. Presumably posting to the root forum is meant to be for TA only, so they disabled automatic “community” post deletion.
Rdglady - good idea! We ought to work our way up to the big geopolitical ones - perhaps we could start with Yorkshire v Lancashire and go from there...?
Hi from sunny Barbados ---------------well I hope it's sunny, it's only just daylight here.  Peace and Love to everyone .
I'm surprised it has lasted this long, although it is entertaining reading...
Interesting to note that it took 24 hours to get the first response. It must have been out in cyberspace and bounced back in.
It beats reading about the corona virus ..it will probably have as many reviews by the time I get up in the morning..
interesting too that when an inappropriate message is posted, the ta bots can close it down after two reports, yet after numerous reports of "spam" etc, nothing happens !
Interesting when you click on "Browse all world topics" at the top of the page

Morning from southern Spain where half the town are about to trundle round the streets on bicycles. Tax free.
gg - post 83 was 'self removed'.SWT
Nothing can stop the Sashonavirus...:-)

If it is a hack/glitch then I would think that is up to TA engineers to deal with, not the moderators as that would not be in their remit and we all know how long TA engineers get round to dealing with problems concerning the site.Angie.

All these interesting new posters! Enjoy it while you can folks!
Good morning World!
How come this crud is appearing on the Costa del Sol forums ???
Good morning everyone from cold Pittsburgh. It's 19 degrees (-17c) here today and expecting snow. I hope everyone has a wonderful day!!
hi,In the Buenos Aires forum its also visible.
A M << How come this crud is appearing on the Costa del Sol forums ??? >>Because it is on the 'World' forum so shows up on every forum worldwide.Angie
Wow its colder in Pittsburgh than Toronto....thanks for the celsius conversion :)Keep this cool worldly thread going....morning again everyone...pretty sure its warm in Buenos Aires right now :)

There is no such thing in Brazil. There is the CPF which is an individual tax ID. You can get CPF at a BR Consulate/Embassy. If you owned a business in BR you would have to have gone to make the legal registration with the Board of Trade or in the Corporate Registry Office.
Technically not all over the world as the servers are in the US
Singapore Lah x
Shows how slow TA are in removing a post.
G'day mate....you guys have to be first at everything don't you :)
Posting only due to FOMO.Drat - missed being #100!
Who cares about the question at this point...how about a March roll call :) Where's everybody in the world heading or just staying home...in Canada most of us try and head south, way south :)

Good morning World,It's wet and windy in suburban Dorset, you'll be pleased to know, and my cat can't decide if he's hungry or cold. I'd look a bit harder at solving the OP's tax residency issue only I'm pinned to the sofa by a needy, greedy , dribbly ginger monster and frankly, neither of us can be bothered at the moment. Maybe laters ...
This is the Coronovirus of tripadvisor posts ...
Get outa that bed you sleepy head....you're missing your chance to say hello to the World :) I wish Sasha would say hello :)
I think this is a job for ... TAColleen!!!
This is fun for a Friday...mind you its hard to keep up with this World :)

Well I am heading to NZ in a few weeks - driving around and catching up with family and friends for a month. Then three weeks in Sydney and Melbourne before coming back to (hopefully by then) sunny London.

Look at all these posters as well.....28k posts, 45k posts, 74k posts, 112k posts!!!!Has nobody got anything to do???Seriously, anyone know the top 5 of TA posters??May as well do something constructive whilst the whole world is talking to each other.John
It's your sort of thread Larry.
Hi mum
You're sloshing petrol all over this thread Bellagio ...!
So this is that sort of thread where we all get to pump up out post count? Cool...

Should I take a trip around the world .... or go somewhere else...?

I'm seriously beginning to wonder what to have for lunch.I have a couple of slightly stale bagels and some cream cheese (but, sadly, no smoked salmon), which would be the quick and lazy solution; or:I have some sweetcure herring which I could make into a salad with some potatos and chopped apple, but which would entail a modicum of cooking and prep work.What would the world do, I wonder?
Just checking in before this thread gets pulled inevitably.

Seems like a great opportunity for me to thank the people of;AmsterdamAntwerpAthensBarcelonaBerlinBrusselsCartagegnaCopenhagenHelsinkiIbizaIstanbulKrakowLanzaroteLas VegasLisbonMalagaMiamiNaplesNew OrleansNew YorkOrlandoParisPisaRomeSaltcoats (Scotland)TalinnTenerifeTorontoand all the lovely Caribbean and Mediterranean islandsGreat holidays, loved your country and hope to visit againColin
Colin - was this just in 2019/20 or a lifetime of travel?SWT
Colin A: where is OZ on your list? Don't we count?
Come on Colin, what's wrong with London?
Did Colin mention Wales ?
I need a jobby!
Made it to Budapest!
#128 Do you mean as in a Scottish jobbie? I know we are all over-sharing, but that feels like a step too far :-)Edited: 6:53 am, February 28, 2020

Okay for our own little towns and villages....Thank you...AberdeenAnstruther Caravan ParkArranBelfastBlackpoolDumfriesDundeeEdinburghLiverpoolLONDON x 12 visistsMargateNewcastleScarborough & Cayton BayStirlingOz and the Far East? My wife is looking at cruises for that part of the world so its a "maybe soon"Colin
I'm surprised...Oz is usually first :)
Jeny5Sorry we never got to Wales.In the mid 70s my Mum and Dad teased me with a possible summer holiday in Colwyn Bay.I read all the brochures and was really annoyed when we went to Scarborough again
I think TA is loving the worldly exposure :) Seems we're all playing nice and good people :)
OK. I've gone from being pissed off about a hack to delighting in the international gathering of good will.Hello to all!
Ah, yes, spelling mistake. A big, fat, smelly, u-bend-blocking jobbie.But I'm going to keep it in till there's a post 299.
@Leagle  +1
I'm with Leagle - what a lovely thread for a cold, wet, and dismal Friday. We should do this more often:)

Just saying hello one more time to the four corners of the world...I knew it wasn't round :) This almost turned into a foody forum a while back...a bagel with smoked salmon and cream cheese is popular here as well....menu call...who's eating what and when, I know why :)
Wow! Never seen this before!Afternoon from cold, wet Prestwick, Scotland, ☺
Another +1 for Leagle from Gouda, the Netherlands.Surely, if you had ever lost your faith in humanity, this thread restores it. It just warms my heart!Happy Friday, World!
Hey all from a miserable north east England & Sunny Beach Bulgaria forum. Hope your all having a great Friday :)
I may have to skip work today and keep reading and posting...I didn't think the world had such a sense of humor...I can hardly finish my bagel :)
Yes so nice to see eveyone getting along without the usual harassing and snarky comments that you see on some forums. Love the interaction on this thread :)Angie.Edited: 7:09 am, February 28, 2020
The Cuban forum is so boring right now :)
hol_loverDarlington:Hi neighbour. Fancy meeting you here.You are tight it's sure a wet, miserable and cold day here in the North East of England.
We must be on a record setting post pace :) I think I am anyway...what a wonderful world :)

Colin and everybody else: you absolutely should visit the Engadin St. Moritz area in Switzerland, at the moment sun and snow and good clean air! See https://www.engadin.ch/en - beautiful in summer an winter and Colin seems not to have enjoyed it so far?
That's it Bell...join in the fun :) Where's the rest of the Cuba forumers btw...they're missing something special and quite worldly :)

Wow-surprised to see this thread still going. Had to go out in the torrential rain & winds to get our ordered Mexican pesos for our fast approaching hols to Cabo & ingredients for our traditional Welsh cawl (google it) as it's St David's Day sunday. Wales-where men are men & sheep are worried lol so greetings from Llanelli on the Welsh Riviera minus the sun!!!

I'm having a Waitrose Low Fat Greek yogurt ( courtesy of Massy Supermarket , Holetown Barbados ) with fresh Blueberries for Breakfast . Smoked Salmon is too expensive here. Loving this World wide friendliness and participation. Hope it carries on.  I haven't a clue about Shasa's question, but thanks all the same for this thread.
I mean say hi to the world Bell not just your neighbor :)
#136 Not long to wait!I've just had some Cheddars crackers with cream cheese and onion chutney. Delicious.Off to see Dark Waters at the movies tonight.
What, did Sasha ask a question ...#120. Easy answer. You cannot possibly have the bagel if you do not have smoked salmon. What kind of culinary heathen are you???
In other news:Lady Gaga dropped a new video a few hours ago at midnight (EST / UTC-5:00)
Bien di Engadina (e Surselva) dalla bassa. I can only second Engadiner's comment: Switzerland has some stunning and very beautiful winter destinations.
I'm having eggs, bacon and grits. It's cold this morning.
You sound like a cheese lover Elle :)

With the miserable and cold weather, I shall be heating up some soup I made yesterday - tomato and basil, and then maybe cheese and crackers for my lunch.Shame some posts have been reported and removed as off topic - like Colin's list of countries he has visited. Harmless and no more off topic than most others, given nobody can answer the OP who clearly wasn't expecting an answer.SWT
Can we close Topic, TA instead of removing genuine Posters ?
Hilarious!Reply number one which said something along the lines of "I really have no idea" has been deleted as inappropriate!!Yet the post remains.
Luckyme - absolutely, no lactose issues here!
Yes Colin's post started with Hello Amsterdam. Pity it was removed.
I'm typing as fast as I can and still about 4-5 posts behind...my keyboard is very warm and battery low :)
@bellagio:Hey neighbour! Roll on summer :)
This is like the world's biggest What'sApp group!

Teaghan, I did in fact have smoked salmon but my wife (and the bloody cat) finished it off last night as a late-night snack. I AM NOT A CULINARY HEATHEN - of course I would have SS to go with cream cheese and bagels. It's just that it's orrible outside and I can't be ersed to go out. Just put it down to the sacrifices we make with pride (in the name of love).Hang on - did you see what I did there? U2 song titles in culinary threads for a bonus point....
Hope someone has the answer the original question before it is closed
Well off to work, damit! Being Canadian I just want to thank everybody and their keyboards...it's been a great read so far...keep on typing world :)
#168 I saw what you did. Very impressed. Damn cats, they are so selfish. Maybe you should send it out in the cold to get some more.
How has this thread magically appeared on the Antalya Province, Turkey forum? TA often moves in mysterious ways but not usually this baffling :o) :o)
You do realise that this type of global communication is what spreads coronavirus......
Great thread .. how's it done
Really impressive for a first time poster - must be a record!
vipfamily,its on every forum on TA, including travelling with pets.
What about the guidelines about posting the same message on different forums?????
# 172 ... 1 bonus point. See if you can get up to ... 40.It's turning into a beautiful day!
He only posted once and by some miracle managed to access 'Root' forum.
Hey Nicksy.....congrats on your 10,000th post.John

I'm an American currently in Ireland and been struck down with a stupid cold. Reading this is the most fun I've had in days (and the longest I've stayed awake!).(I must be getting better, the food descriptions are actually enticing. I've been living on orange juice, chicken broth and toast.)Cheers, everyone!
Welcome to the Manchester forum??

Well, I must say OZ really is the lucky country right now.It is 10.49pm, a nice balmy summer night, sitting on my back deck enjoying a voddie or two and being endlessly entertained without having to go anywhere.The Kiwis have probably gone to bed by now and are missing all the fun.And I don't have to get up and go anywhere in the morning. Just as well, I could be captivated all night.Edited: 7:52 am, February 28, 2020
Its obvious by now that TA have no idea how to remove this post!  Presumably no one there knows how to access the World Forum either.
I don't know what's weirderSomeone posting on the world forumorThe guy posting from Buenos Aires is Russian
Everyone in the TA office is probably running around right now like Basil Fawlty.
this is spreading faster than COVID-19 SS

So who’s taking screenshots of this entire thread, so that once it does get removed, we at least have something to show our grandchildren when we’re old and decrepit to prove the world was a better place in the old days?I’m too lazy, to be honest, especially after my excellent lunch consisting of two classic Brabantse worstenbroodjes. https:/…worstenbroodjes.htm
@185, so is the OP.
Good morning World from the Midwest! This has brightened my morning.
If the OP is getting an e mail every time they have a reply they are now in meltdown!
#186 - yes, both of them...

Hello World! I think this is really lovely, I have a very warm smile on my face reading all the comments. It will go on my things to be greatful for today list. Wet and rainy here too today in Cumbria but its almost the weekend xx

Interesting thread for a Friday morning. Hi from Ontario, Canada.

When I saw “world forum” I thought someone was playing an April Fools day joke on us. But then I realised it’s 29th February (here in Australia) which is Leap Day. So then I just had to read every post on the thread just to make sure there wasn’t a proposal of marriage hiding in the thread somewhere. There isn’t. I’m disappointed. But it was a hilarious thread. :) ;)
Loving this crazy happening.Saying a big hello to the World from a very wet and windy North Lincolnshire. England
Hello everyone...we will all have to do this again some time :)
What a great opportunity for people from around the world to wish sssnakes a happy birthday!!! ;-)
At least as I rotate through my regular forums I can keep in touch with the posts on this thread as the thread is always there. Good stuff.
Happy Birthday, sssnakes!
This entire World thread is brought to you by the United States Internal Revenue Service. We'd like to help you with your gross income.Happy Friday Y'All!

Ah the OTC takes some understanding - though the clue is in the name.A random thread starts say on what you had for dinner and can change subject thoughout the thread, off topic. You can't edit and you can't delete so be careful what you say. Predictive text can be interesing.There are word games galore, some require intelligence and others, well anyone can post.You need a sense of humour and not take yourself too seriously. Also be tollerentish of other nations and ideas.They send all the surveys and advertising over there and it's open season.Also threads from forums that are off topic. The posters sometimes find them and they can stay awhile but random people will butt in so no place for serious discussion.Takes some getting used to but they're a good bunchNight, night Westiegal, sweet dreams.Edited: 5:38 pm, March 01, 2020
